src: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
mt: Ilmning asosiy maqsadi dunyoni tushunish orqali ilmiy usul orqali ishlashdir. Buning uchun ilmiy usul asosan ilmiy tadqiqotlarni boshqaradi. Biroq, bu yagona emas, tajriba, tajriba shuningdek, bir yoki bir nechta mumkin bo'lgan hipotezalarni chetlatish uchun ishlatiladigan test, savollar berish va kuzatish ham ilmiy tadqiqotlarni boshqaradi.
ref: Ilm-fanning asosiy maqsadi ilmiy usul orqali dunyoning qanday ishlashini aniqlashdir. Aslini olganda, bu usul boshqa ko'plab ilmiy izlanishlarga yo'lboshchilik qiladi. Biroq bu faqatgina tajribalar emas va tajriba — bu mumkin bo'lgan bir yoki bir nechta gipoteza, masalaning qo'yilishi va ilmiy tadqiqotlar uchun oriyentir bo'lib ham xizmat qiluvchi kuzatuvlarni o'tkazishni istisno qilish uchun foydalaniluvchi testdir.

src: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: To'g'ri kelishmaydigan furoshshoylar kichik hududga to'g'ri keladi, boshqa qo'rqinchli oylar bilan solishtirganda, lekin ular o'z yo'lidagi barcha narsani vayron qilishi mumkin. To'g'ri kelishmaydigan furoshshoylar o'rab o'tadi, binolardan poydevorlarni olib tashlaydi va avtomobillarni osmonga tashlaydi. Eng qo'rqinchli ikki foiz to'g'ri kelishmaydigan furoshshoylar uchdan oshmaydigan uch soatdan ko'p davom etadi. Bu monstrolar 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph) gacha tezlikda harakatlanadi.
ref: Tornadolar, boshqa kuchli bo'ronlar bilan taqqoslaganda, kichik hududga zarba beradi, ammo yo'lida uchragan har qanday narsani vayron qilishi mumkin. Tornadolar daraxtlarni ildizi bilan qo'porib tashlaydi, binolardan taxtalarni sug'urib oladi va avtomobillarni osmonga uchiradi. Tornadolarning eng kuchli ikki foizi uch soatdan ko'proq davom etadi. Bu dahshatli bo'ronlarda shamolning tezligi 480 km/soatgacha (133 m/s; 300 milya/soat) yetadi.

src: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
mt: Insonlarning katta narsalarni katta ko'rish uchun qo'llab-quvvatlash uchun lentalar qilish va ishlatish minglab yillar davomida amalga oshirilgan. Biroq, birinchi to'g'ri teleskoplar Yevropada 16-asrning oxirida ishlab chiqarilgan. Ushbu teleskoplardagi ikkita lentani birlashtirish orqali uzoq narsalarni ham yaqinroq, ham kattaroq ko'rish mumkin.
ref: Insonlar ming-minglab yillar davomida kattalashtirish uchun linzalar ishlab chiqarishmoqda va foydalanib kelishmoqda. Biroq birinchi haqiqiy teleskoplar Yevropada XVI asrning oxirlarida yaratildi. Ushbu teleskoplarda olisdagi obyektlarni yaqinroq va kattaroq ko'rsatish uchun ikkita linza kombinatsiyasidan foydalanilgan.

src: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
mt: Muhammad bu dunyodan tashqarida bo'lgan narsalarga qiziqish bilan qiziqib, “Noor” (nur) tog'ining “Hira‘” (qo'rqinch) yonida o'zini o'ylash uchun ko'p marta tashrif buyurardi. Bu yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan yerdan o'zgacha bo'lgan
ref: "Muhammad bu dunyo hayotidan tashqarida bo'lgan masalalarga chuqur qiziqqan. U tafakkur yuritish uchun ""Nur"" (yorug'lik) tog'idagi ""Hiro"" nomi bilan tanilgan g'orga tez-tez borib turgan. Zamonlar osha butun qolib kelgan g'orning o'zi Muhamamad kechirgan ruhiy moyilliklarning yorqin tasvirini beradi. Makkaning shimolidagi tog'lardan birining ustida joylashgan mazkur g'or dunyoning qolgan qismidan butunlay ajratilgan. Aslida, hatto agar kimdir uning mavjudligini bilganida ham, uni topish umuman oson emas. g'orning ichiga kirish, bu butunlay yakkalanishdir. Tepadagi tiniq, go'zal osmon va atrofdagi ko'plab tog'lardan boshqa hech narsa ko'rinmaydi. g'or ichida bu dunyoning juda kichik qismini ko'rish yoki eshitish mumkin."

src: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
mt: Angliyada 16-asrda wagonways qurilgan. Wagonways faqat paralel bo'lgan yog'ochlar tizimidan iborat bo'lib, ular ularni tashishda yuraklaridan katta tezlik va yuklarni tashishga imkon berdi. Kross-ties juda dard qilishda qo'llanilgan. ref: Vagon yo'llari Angliyada 16-asrdayoq barpo etilgan. Vagon yo'llari shunchaki parallel yog'och plankalaridan tashkil topganligiga qaramasdan, ular tortish otlarga kattaroq tezlikka erishish va o'sha kunlardagi bir oz notekis bo'lgan yo'llariga nisbatan kattaroq yuklarni tortish imkonini berdi. Temir yo'llar shpallari juda erta o'ylab topildi. Lekin agar ularning ustida temir ham bo'lsa, temir yo'llar yanada foydali bo'lishini sekin-astalik bilan anglab yetdilar. Bu umumiy amaliyotga aylangan, biroq temir vagonlarning yog'ochdan yusalgan g'ildiraklarining ko'proq yemirilishiga olib kelgan. Vaqti kelib, yog'och g'ildiraklarning o'rnini temir g'ildiraklar egalladi. 1767-yilda dastlabki to'liq temir relslar ishlab chiqarildi.

src: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
mt: Romantizmda katta elementi madaniy determinizm, Goethe, Fichte va Schlegel kabi yozuvchilardan olingan. Romantizm kontekstida geografiya shaxslarni shakllantirdi, va keyinroq unga bog'liq an'analar va madaniyat paydo bo'ldi, va bu, jamiyatdagi joy bilan uzviy bog'liq bo'lgan, aralash qonunlardan ko'ra yaxshi edi.
ref: Romantizmda Gyote, Fixte hamda Shlegel singari yozuvchilardan qolgan madaniy determinizmning yirik elementi bor edi. Romantizm nuqtai-nazaridan geografiya shaxslarni shakllantirdi, vaqtlar o'tishi bilan o'sha geografiyaga bog'liq bo'lgan odatlar va madaniyat yuzaga keldi, bular jamiyatdagi o'rin bilan uyg'un bo'lgan holda o'zboshimchalik bilan kiritilgan qonunlardan yaxshiroq edi.

src: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."
mt: Texnologik determinizm - bu amaliyotda keng qamrovli g'oyalar to'plamini ifodalaydi, shundan biri texnologiya tomonidan to'g'risi bilan yoki texnologik imperativ yoki to'g'risi bilan odamning manzarasi texnologiyaga asoslangan tushuncha bilan ajralib turadi. Texnologik determinizmning aksariyat tushunchalari ikkita umumiy g'oya bilan bog'liq: texnologiya o'zining yo'lini o'z-o'zidan, madaniy yoki siyosiy ta'sirga qaramay, kengayib borayotgan yo'lda, va keyinroq texnologiya jamiyatga o'ziga xos, shuningdek, ijtimoiy sharoitga bog'liq emas, degan ma'noni tushunishga o'xshaydi. Masalan, biror kishi avtomobilni qo'llab-quvvatlashda yurish yo'li o'z-o'zidan keladi. Ammo, milliy yo'l tarmog'i faqat bir nechta avtomobillar uchun iqtisodiy ravishda ishlab chiqarish mumkin emas, shuning uchun yangi ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish narxini kamaytirish uchun ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish usullari ishlab chiqarish us
ref: "Texnologik determinizm — bu texnologik turtki yoki texnologik zaruratdan tortib, inson taqdiri ilmiy qonunlar va ularning texnologiyalardagi aksi bilan bog'liq asosiy mantiq tomonidan boshqariladi degan qat'iy tushunchagacha bo'lgan amaliyotdagi g'oyalarning keng doirasini qamrab oluvchi atamadir. Texnologik determinizmning aksariyat tavsiflari ikki umumiy g'oyani o'zida mujassam etadi: texnologiya rivojlanishining o'zi asosan siyosiy yoki madaniy ta'sirdan tashqaridagi yo'ldan boradi va texnologiyaning, o'z navbatida, ijtimoiy shartli emas, aksincha, o'ziga xos bo'lgan jamiyatlarda ""ta'sirlari"" mavjud. Masalan, motorli avtomobil mos ravishda yo'llarning yaxshilanishiga sabab bo'la oladi, deyish mumkin. Ammo davlat miqyosidagi yo'l tarmog'i faqat bir qancha avtomobillar uchungina iqtisodiy jihatdan yashovchan emas, shu sababli avtomobillarga egalik narxini pasaytirish maqsadida ishlab chiqarishning yangi usullari ishlab chiqilgan. Ommaviy ravishda avtomobilga ega bo'lish yo'llardagi halokatlarning ko'payishiga ham olib keladi, bu esa sog'liqni saqlash sohasida shikastlangan tanalarni tuzatish uchun yangi usullarning ixtiro qilinishiga yetaklaydi."

src: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
mt: ""Ushqozonning yuqori qismi ko'rinishida V shaklida bo'lgan belgi ustun bo'lib, past qismi ko'rinishida uchburchmga o'xshash bo'lgan belgi past bo'lib, yuqori belgi ustun bo'lib, past belgi past bo'lib, belgi ustun bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi past bo'lib, belgi
ref: """Yuqori kamonsimon"" belgi V ga o'xshaydi va ""pastki kamonsimon belgi"" pastki tarafi tushirib qoldirilgan kvadratga yoki kubga o'xshaydi. Yuqoriga degani uchidan boshlashingiz va torni bosishingiz kerakligi va pastga degani strelkadan (qo'lingiz kamonni ushlab turgan nuqta) boshlashingiz va torni tortishingiz kerakligini anglatadi. Yuqori tor odatda yumshoqroq tovushni, pastki tor esa kuchliroq va shiddatliroq tovushni hosil qiladi. o'z belgilaringizni qalamda chizishdan tortinmang, biroq yodda tuting, bosma kamoncha belgilari musiqiy maqsadda yozilgan, shu sababli ular odatda e'tiborga olinishi kerak."

src: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
mt: Hominozlar qo'polariga nisbatan, ular o'z qo'llarini harakatda yoki og'irlikni o'tkazishda yoki daraxtlarda o'tishda ishlatmaydilar. ref: Boshqa primatlardan farqli ravishda, gominidlar siljish yoki vaznini ko'tarish yoxud daraxtlar oralab o'tishda ortiq qo'llaridan foydalanmaydi. Shimpanzening qo'l va oyoq kaftlari o'lcham va uzunlik jihatidan bir xil, bu qo'lning bo'g'imda yurish paytida og'irlikni ko'tarish uchun foydalanilishida aks etadi. src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
mt: XX asr tadqiqotlari ko'rsatdiki, genetik o'zgarishlarning ikkita havzasi mavjud: yashirin va ifodalangan. Mutatsiya yangi genetik o'zgarishlarni qo'shadi, va tanlash ularni ifodalangan o'zgarishlardan havzadan chiqaradi. Segregatsiya va rekombinatsiya har bir avlodda ifodalangan o'zgarishlarni yashirin havzaga qayta qo'yadi.
ref: Yigirmanchi asrdagi tadqiqotlar genetik o'zgarishning ikki havzasi: yashirin va ochiq ifodalangan havzalari mavjudligini ko'rsatdi. Mutatsiya yangi genetik variatsiyani qo'shadi va saralash tezlashgan variatsiyaning zaxirasidan uni olib tashlaydi. Segregatsiya va rekombinatsiya har bir avlod bilan ikkala pul o'rtasidagi variatsiyalarni aralashtiradi.

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

ref: "Savannadan tashqarida, inson kabi ovqat hazm qilish tizimiga ega bo'lgan primat uchun aminokislotaga bo'lgan ehtiyojni mavjud o'simlik manbalaridan qondirish mushkul. Bundan tashqari bunday qila olmaslik quyidagi jiddiy oqibatlarga: depressiyaning ortishi, ozuqaviy moddalar yetishmasligi va nihoyat o'limga olib keladi. Yaproqlar hamda dukkakli ekinlarda bor bo'lgan oqsillar eng oson yetishtiriladigan o'simlik manbalari bo'lardi, lekin biz singari primatlar uchun pishirilmaguncha ularni hazm qilish mushkul. Bundan farqli o'laroq, mavjudot ozuqalar (chumolilar, termitlar, tuxumlar) nafaqat yengil hazm bo'ladi, balki ular muhim aminokislotalarning barchasini o'z ichiga olgan yuqori miqdordagi oqsillar bilan ham ta'minlaydi. Barcha narsalar hisobga olingan holda, agar ajdodlarimiz o'zlarining ""oqsil muammolarini"" bugungi kunda savanna shimpanzelariga o'xshash usulda hal qilgan bo'lsalar, ajablanmasligimiz kerak."

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
mt: Subkultura o'zgaruvchan jamiyat standartlariga qarshi his-tuyg'ularni birlashtiradi va ularni identifikatsiya qilish imkonini beradi. Subkultura a'zolari odatda ushbu subkulturaning a'zosi ekanligini belgilash uchun ushbu subkulturaning a'zolari uchun xos bo'lgan va simvolik uslubda fashizmlar, xatti-harakatlar va argotni qo'llash orqali belgilashadi.
ref: Submadaniyatlar ijtimoiy standartlar tomonidan e'tiborsiz qoldirilganligini his qiluvchi va o'zlikni anglash hissini rivojlantirishga imkon beruvchi hamfikr shaxslarni birlashtiradi. Submadaniyatlar a'zolarning yoshi, etnik kelib chiqishi, sinfi, joylashuvi va/yoki jinsiga qarab ajralib turishi mumkin. Submadaniyatni yaqqol belgilab beradigan sifatlar lingvistik, estetik, diniy, siyosiy, jinsiy, geografik bo'lishi yoxud faktorlar kombinatsiyasi bo'lishi mumkin. Submadaniyat a'zolari ko'pincha o'z a'zoliklarini modalar, xulq-atvor va jargonlarni o'z ichiga olgan uslubdan o'ziga xos va ramziy foydalanish orqali namoyon etadilar.

src: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
mt: O'g'il va qizlarning irq va irqiy stereotiplarga oid tushuncha o'ziga xos yoshda rivojlanadi va bu irqiy stereotiplar xatti-harakatga ta'sir qiladi. Masalan, o'g'il va qizlarning o'ziga xos irqi bilan bog'liq bo'lgan stereotiplar o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini bilganda, o'qishda yomon ko'rinadigan irqga tegishli ekanligini
ref: "Irq va irqiy stereotiplar haqida tushuncha yosh bolalarda juda erta shakllanadi va mazkur irqiy stereotiplar xulq-atvorga ta'sir o'tkazadi. Masalan, o'zini ""maktabda yaxshi o'qimaydi"" stereotipi bilan qaraladigan irqiy ozchilikka mansub deb bilgan bolalar o'zlarining irqiga oid stereotip haqida eshitganidan so'ng maktabda yaxshi o'qimay qo'yishga moyil bo'lgan."

src: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."
mt: "Boshqa bir usulda ijtimoiylashuvning muhimligini ta'kidlash uchun feral yoki o'rxsh bo'lgan bolalarga murojaat qilinadi. Bu bolalar odatda ota-onalar tomonidan tashlanadi (asosan ularning o'z bolalari). Bunday bolalar ota-onalari tomonidan qabul qilinmagan yoki bolaning og'ir ruhiy yoki jismoniy zaifligi tufayli tashlanadi. Feral bolalar ota-onalari tomonidan o'zgartirilmagan yoki o'z-o'zidan qochib ketgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvonlar tomonidan o'rxsh bo'lgan. Boshqalari o'rxsh bo'lgan hayvon
ref: "Beparvolik, baxtsiz hodisa yoki qasddan zo'ravonlik qilish orqali, voyaga yetayotganida kattalar tomonidan ijtimoiylashtirilmagan bolalar holatlaridan iborat kam sonli noxush holatlarini misol qilib keltirish ijtimoiylashuv muhimligini ko'rsatish uchun qo'llaniladigan keng tarqalgan usul hisoblanadi. Buday bolalar ""vahshiy"" yoki yovvoyi deb ataladi. Ba'zi vahshiy bolalar odamlar (odatda ularning ota-onalari) tomonidan cheklab qo'yilgan; ba'zi hollarda bolaning bunday tashlab ketilishiga ota-onalarning bolaning og'ir aqliy yoki jismoniy zaiflashuvidan yuz o'girishlari sabab bo'lgan. Vahshiy bolalar tashlab ketilishi yoki qochib ketishidan avval jiddiy zo'ravonlik yoki jarohatlarni boshdan kechirgan bo'lishlari mumkin. Boshqalarning hayvonlar tarafidan katta qilingani da'vo qilinadi; ba'zilarining yovvoyi tabiatda o'zlari yashaganligi aytiladi. To'liq inson bo'lmagan mavjudotlar tomonidan ulg'aytirilganda, yirtqich bola deyarli to'liqligicha aynan parvarish qilgan hayvonning xatti-harakatlariga o'xshash xulq-atvorni (jismoniy chegaralar doirasida), masalan, insonlardan qo'rqish yoki ularga befarqlikni namoyish etadi."

src: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

Yordamchi qishloq xo'jaligi — almashlab ekish bilan birga ekologik hududda saqlanib qolgan urug'lardan foydalanish yoki boshqa nisbatan oson texnikalar yordamida hosilni ko'paytiruvchi sodda, ko'p hollarda organik tizimdir. Tarixda ko'plab dehqonlar yordamchi qishloq xo'jaligi bilan mashg'ul bo'lishgan hamda ko'plab rivojlanayotgan davlatlarda hali ham shunday bo'lib qolmoqda.

src: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
mt: Turizmning eng keng tarqalgan turi bo'lgan rekreatsion turizmda odamlar o'zlarining kundalik hayotidan juda farq qiladigan joyga borib, o'zlarining o'ylari va fikrlari bilan o'zlarini qo'llab-quvvatlaydilar. Boshqa joylarga borish uchun turizmga tashrif buyuruvchilar ko'pincha dengiz bo'ylarida, tematik parklarda va kamplarda joylashgan.
ref: Ehtimol, turizmning eng keng tarqalgan turi bu aksariyat odamlar sayohat bilan bog'laydigan rekreatsion turizmdir. Bu kishilarning odatiy kundalik hayot tarzidan ancha farqli bo'lgan yerga dam olish hamda ko'ngil ochish uchun borishidir. Plyajlar, mavzuli parklar va lager maydonlari ko'pincha hordiq chiqaruvchi sayyohlar tez-tez tashrif buyuradigan eng ommabop joylardir. Agar muayyan joyga tashrif buyurishdan maqsad uning tarixi hamda madaniyati bilan tanishish bo'lsa, unda turizmning mazkur turi madaniy turizm deb ataladi. Sayohatchilar muayyan davlatning turli diqqatga sazovor manzillariga tashrif buyurishlari yoxud shunchaki faqat bitta hududga e'tibor qaratishni afzal ko'rishlari mumkin.

src: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
mt: Shaxslar bir necha o'n yillik davomida bizga o'z kuchlari va sevgi bilan shaxsiy, oilaviy va tashkilotiy tarixlarni tahlil qilishga yordam berdi. Shaxslar o'z tarixlari orqali tashkilotning madaniyatini tushunishga yordam berdi. Shaxslar o'z muvaffaqiyatlarini va muvaffaqiyatsizliklarni tahlil qilish orqali tashkilotning mission va tashkilotning o'ziga xosligini tushunishga yordam berdi. Bu muvaffaqiyatlar tashkilotning o'zgarishiga yordam berdi. Tashkilotning o'zgarishiga yordam berdi. Tashkilotning o'zgarishiga yordam berdi. Tashkilotning o'zgarishiga yordam berdi. ref: Bunda qatnashgan kishilar bir necha o'n yillar davomida qiyinchiliklar va hattoki muvaffaqiyatsizliklarni ochiq baholagan holda kuchli tomonlarimiz va ehtiroslarimizni baholashimizga yordam berdilar. Shaxsiy, oilaviy hamda tashkiliy hikoyalari bilan o'rtoqlashuvchi kishilarni eshitish vaqtida bizda bebaho o'tmish va tashkilot madaniyatiga yaxshi yoki yomon ta'sir ko'rsatgan shaxslarning ayrimlari haqida tushuncha hosil bo'ldi. Biror kishining tarixini tushunish madaniyatni tushunishni anglatmaydi, lekin hech bo'lmaganda kishilarga tashkilot tarixi doirasida ularning qayerga tushib qolganini his qilishga yordam beradi. Muvaffaqiyatlarni baholash va xatolardan ogoh bo'lish davomida alohida shaxslar va butun qatnashuvchi shaxslar tashkilot qadriyatlari, missiyasi va harakatlantiruvchi kuchlarini yanada chuqurroq kashf qiladilar. Ushbu holatda, oldingi tadbirkorlik xatti-harakati holatlari hamda erishilgan yutuqlarni yodga olish insonlarga yangi o'zgarishlar va mahalliy cherkovlar uchun yangi yo'nalishlarga ochiq bo'lishiga yordam berdi. Muvaffaqiyat haqidagi bunday hikoyalar kelajakdagi o'zgarishga nisbatan ijobiy moyilliklarni yaratgan holda o'zgarishdan qo'rqish hissini kamaytirdi.

src: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
mt: Postmodern o'qish uslubida absolyutlardan ozodlik bor. Boshqa bir narsa emas, boshqa bir narsa emas, o'qish yaxshi usul bilan o'qish. Aslida, boshqa bir narsa emas, boshqa bir narsa emas, o'qish. Bizning hozirgi tajribamiz barcha qilish va ma'lumot berish, o'qish asosidagi teleko'rsatuvlarni ko'rsatadi. Biz hech qachon avtomobilni qayta ishlash, bizning xonamizdagi fontanda qurish, Peru'da qadimiy qoldiqlarni tekshirish, yoki qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uchun qo'shimcha qilish uch
ref: Postmodern ta'lim yondashuvi mutloqliklardan ozodlikni taklif qiladi. o'rganish uchun yagona yaxshi usul mavjud emas. Aslida, o'rganish uchun bittagina yaxshi narsa mavjud emas. O'rganish taqdim etilgan bilim hamda o'rganuvchi orasidagi tajribada sodir bo'ladi. Barcha o'z qo'lingiz bilan bajariladigan ishlar va axborot taqdim etish bilan bog'liq amaldagi tajribamiz, o'rganishga asoslangan teleko'rsatuvlar shuni ko'rsatib turibdi. Shu tarzda, bizlarning ko'pchiligimiz o'zimiz hech qachon qatnashmaydigan yoki o'sha bilimlarni qo'llamaydigan jarayon yoki tajriba to'g'risida ma'lumot beruvchi teleko'rsatuvlarni tomosha qilyapmiz. Biz hech qachon avtomobilni kapital ta'mirlamaymiz, qadimgi xarobalarni o'rganish uchun Peruga sayohat qilmaymiz yoki qo'shnimizning uyini qayta modellashtirmaymiz.

src: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
mt: Uyqu to'xtatish quyidagi usullardan birini qo'llash orqali amalga oshiriladi: uyquda qo'rqituvchi alarm sozlash, bu yerda sizni to'liq o'qirib qo'yishga yo'qolmaydi. Agar siz uyquda alarmni qayta sozlay boshlansa, u boshqa tomonda joylashtirilishi mumkin, bu sizga uyqudan qo'rqitish uchun o'qirib chiqishga to'g'ri keladi. Boshqa bioritm asosidagi variantlar orasida uyqudan oldin suv ichish (shuningdek, suv yoki choy, diuretik sifatida tanilgan) kabi suyuqliklar ichish, bu yerda siz uyqudan qo'rqitish uchun o'qirib chiqishga to'g'ri keladi.
ref: Uyqu uzilishi — bu sizning odatdagi uyqu vaqtingizdan atay uyg'onish va qisqa vaqtdan keyin (10–60 daqiqa) uyquga ketish jarayonidir. Sizni to'liq uyg'otmasdan xushingizga keltirish uchun birmuncha sokin bo'lgan budilnikdan foydalanib, buni osongina bajarish mumkin. Agar siz uyqudaligingizda soatni o'chirib qo'yayotgan bo'lsangiz, uni xonaning boshqa burchagiga qo'yishingiz mumkin, bu holda uni o'chirish uchun o'rningizdan turishingizga to'g'ri keladi. Bioritmga asoslanuvchi boshqa variantlar uyqudan avval ko'p miqdorda suyuqlik (xususan, suv yoki choy, siydik haydovchi sifatida ma'lum) ichishdan iborat, bu bovul qilish uchun turishga majburlaydi.

src: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
mt: Ba'zilarning fikricha, ko'p marta ishlab chiqarilgan lucid ruyhalar tajribasi ko'p marta bo'lsa, bu juda yorqin bo'lishi mumkin. Bu hodisa asosan lucid ruyhalar o'z-o'zidan uzoqroq vaqt davomida bo'lishi natijasida yuzaga keladi. Yomon ruyhalar har bir tungi ko'p emas, lekin har bir tungi bir yoki ikki marta bo'lishi mumkin. Bu holatda siz har bir tungi 20 yoki 30 daqiqada qaytib kelib televideniya ko'rishni boshlardisiz. Bu hodisa sizning bepul ruyhalariga qaraganda juda yorqin bo'lishi mumkin.
ref: Ayrim kishilar tez-tez sun'iy ravishda qo'zg'atilgan ongli tushlarni ko'rish juda ham toliqtirishi mumkin deb hisoblaydi. Bu hodisaning asosiy sababi REM fazasi o'rtasidagi vaqt uzunligini kengaytiruvchi ongli tushlarning natijasidir. Har tuniga kamroq sondagi REM lar bilan siz haqiqiy uyquni boshingizdan kechiradigan va tanangiz qayta tiklanadigan bu holat muammoga aylanish uchun yetarli darajada kamroq bo'lib boradi. Bu go'yoki har yigirma yoki o'ttiz daqiqada uyg'onib, televizor ko'rish kabi toliqtiradi. Natija sizning miyangizning bir kechada qanchalik aniq tush ko'rishga urinishiga bog'liq.

src: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
mt: Ba'zilarning fikricha, ko'p marta ishlab chiqarilgan lucid ruyhalar tajribasi ko'p marta bo'lsa, bu juda yorqin bo'lishi mumkin. Bu hodisa asosan lucid ruyhalar o'z-o'zidan uzoqroq vaqt davomida bo'lishi natijasida yuzaga keladi. Yomon ruyhalar har bir tungi ko'p emas, lekin har bir tungi bir yoki ikki marta bo'lishi mumkin. src: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
mt: Virtual jamoalar ancha o'zgacha bo'lgan jamoalarga nisbatan muvaffaqiyatga erishishga majburlanadi, lekin ancha subtillar farqlar mavjud. Virtual jamoa a'zolari odatdagi jamoa a'zolari kabi o'z jamoasining birinchi qo'llab-quvvatlovchisi sifatida ishlaydi. Ularning jamoalari vaqt zonalariga ko'ra farqlar bilan ishlaydi, bu ularning mahalliy boshqaruvchilari tomonidan tushunib bo'lmaydi. “Ko'rinmas jamoa” (Larson va LaFasto, 1989, p109) ham virtual jamoaning muhim qismidir. “Ko'rinmas jamoa” har bir a'zoning boshqaruvchisidir. “Ko'rinmas jamoa” har bir a'zoning standartlari uchun javobgardir.
ref: "Virtual jamoalar odatiy jamoalarniki bilan bir xil mukammallik standartlariga amal qiladi, lekin sezilmas farqlar bor. Virtual guruh a'zolari tez-tez o'zlarining jismoniy guruhlari uchun aloqa punkti vazifasini bajaradi. Ularning jamoalari mahalliy boshqaruv tizimi tushunmasligi mumkin bo'lgan turli vaqt zonalariga ko'ra uchrashishi mumkinligi sababli ularda ko'pincha an'anaviy jamoalarga qaraganda ko'proq avtonomiya bo'ladi. Haqiqiy ""ko'rinmas jamoa""ning borligi (Larson hamda LaFasto, 1989, 109-bet) virtual jamoaning o'ziga xos komponenti hamdir. ""Ko'rinmas jamoa"" — bu a'zolarning har biri hisobot beruvchi boshqaruv jamoasidir. Ko'rinmas jamoa har bir a'zo uchun standartlarni belgilab beradi."

src: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
mt: Content teoriyalar odamlarning nima uchun ishlayotganini topishga qaratilgan. Ushbu teoriyalar odamlarning o'ziga xos talablarini yoki/vea istaklarini o'zlashtirishini ko'rsatadi. Ushbu teoriyalar nima uchun odamlar nima qilishga xushmard bo'lishini ko'rib chiqadi va ularning muhitida nima qilish yoki emasligini ko'rsatadi. Ikki mashhur content teoriyasi Maslowning talablar piramidasi teoriyasi va Hertzbergning ikki faktor teoriyasi.
ref: "Kontent nazariyalari diqqatni odamlarga ta'sir qiladigan yoki ularni jalb qiladigan narsalarni topishga qaratilgan. Mazkur nazariyalar shuni ko'rsatadiki, insonlar balog'at yoshiga qadam qo'yguniga qadar, ularda muayyan ichki ehtiyojlar va/yoki xohishlar bo'ladi. Ushbu nazariyalar ma'lum odamlar qilishni istagan ishlarini qilishlariga nima undashini va muhitlaridagi qanday omilar ma'lum narsalarni qilishlaru yoki qilmasliklariga ta'sir qilishini ko'rib chiqadi. Mohiyat bo'yicha qiziqtirishning ikki mashhur nazariyalari — Maslouning ""Ehtiyojlar piramidasi"" nazariyasi va Gersbergning ""Ikki omil"" nazariyasi."

src: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
mt: Uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasi ko'p marta ishlatilgan va ko'pincha naqis qilinadigan qoidadir. Ushbu qoida tasvirda dinamiklikni yaratishga yordam beradi, shuningdek, tasvirda tartibni saqlashga yordam beradi. Ushbu qoida tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga asoslangan bo'lib, tasvirda uchta qismga bo'lish qoidasiga
ref: Ko'p haqorat qilingan va ko'pincha istehzo qilingan uchdan bir qoidasi suratdagi tartib o'lchovini saqlagan holda jo'shqinlikni yaratadigan oddiy yo'riqnomadir. Unda asosiy subyekt uchun eng samarali joy suratni vertikal va gorizontal tarzda uchga bo'ladigan chiziqlar kesishmasida ekanligi aytilgan (namunaga qarang).

src: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
mt: Masalan, dunyodagi eng keng tarqalgan suratga olish formati 35mm bo'lib, analog filmda yakuniy davrda boshqaruvchi bo'lgan. U hozir ham ishlab chiqarilmoqda, lekin ko'proq ahamiyatga ega bo'lib, digital kamera sensor formatlari o'zining nisbatiga egalik qiladi. 35mm format 36mm kenglikda va 24mm balandlikda bo'lib, nisbati shuning uchun 3:2 deb aytiladi. Ko'plab formatlar (APS oilasi formatlari, masalan) bu nisbatga teng yoki u bilan yaqin.
ref: Masalan, dunyodagi eng keng suratga olish formati 35 mm bo'lib, bu analog fotoplyonkalar davri yakunida ustun bo'lgan fotoplyonka o'lchami bo'lgan. U bugungi kunda ham ishlab chiqariladi, biroq eng muhimi, uning tomonlar nisbati raqamli kamera tasvir sensori formatlari tomonidan meros qilib olingan. 35 mm format aslida bir oz chalkash bo'lib, kengligi 36 mm va balandligi 24 mm. Shunga ko'ra, mazkur formatning tomonlar nisbati (eng oddiy butun son nisbatini olish uchun o'n ikkiga bo'lish) 3:2 bo'lishi kerak deyiladi. Ko'plab umumiy formatlar (masalan, APS formatlar oilasi) mazkur tomonlar nisbatiga teng yoki ancha yaqin.

src: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
mt: Zoom linzalarning kamchiliklari shundaki, fokus qattiqligi va fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni va fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerakli linzalar soni fokus uzunliklari uchun kerak
ref: Yaqinlashtiruvchi linzalarning asosiy noqulayligi shundan iboratki, fokusning murakkabligi va fokus masofasiga erishish uchun talab qilingan linza elementlari soni asosiy fokusli linzalarga qaraganda ancha katta bo'ladi. Obyektiv ishlab chiqaruvchilarning obyektiv ishlab chiqarishda erishgan yuqori standartlari tufayli bu tobora arzimas muammoga aylanib bormoqda. Bu yaqinlashtirish linzalari o'zgarmas fokusli linzalar yordamida erishilgan natija bilan taqqoslanadigan rasmlar yaratish imkonini beradi. Yaqinlashtiruvchi obyektivlarning boshqa bir kamchiligi shundaki, obyektivning maksimal diafragmasi (tezligi) odatda pastroq bo'ladi. Bu yorug'lik kam bo'lgan sharoitlarda arzon kattalashtiruvchi linzalardan chaqnoqsiz foydalanishni qiyinlashtiradi.

src: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
mt: Mustahzislik — bu o'zining oxirgi haqiqatiga, xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki Xudoga yaqinlashish, identifikatsiya qilish, yoki xudoga, ruhiy haqiqatga, yoki X
ref: Tasavvuf — bu yakuniy voqelik, ilohiylik, ma'naviy ishonch yoki Xudodan ongli ravishda xabardor bo'lish, o'zlikni anglash, Xudo bilan muloqotda bo'lish istagining mavjudligidir. E'tiqod qiluvchi ilohiy borliq/ma'bud yoki ma'budlarga bo'lgan bevosita tajriba, ichki his yoki tushunchani izlaydi. Shogirdlar hayotning muayyan yo'llarini yoxud ushbu tajribani boyitishga qaratilgan amaliyotlarni davom ettiradilar. Tasavvuf noyob ong holatini, xususan, tinch, ziyrak, saodatli va hatto ekstatik xarakterga ega holatni bevosita boshdan kechirishga urg'u berishi orqali boshqa diniy e'tiqod va ibodat shakllaridan farqlanishi mumkin.

Shogirdlar hayotning muayyan yo'llarini yoxud ushbu tajribani boyitishga qaratilgan amaliyotlarni davom ettiradilar. Tasavvuf noyob ong holatini, xususan, tinch, ziyrak, saodatli va hatto ekstatik xarakterga ega holatni bevosita boshdan kechirishga urg'u berishi orqali boshqa diniy e'tiqod va ibodat shakllaridan farqlanishi mumkin.

src: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
mt: 19-asr va 20-asrlarning katta qismida, Yangi Zelandiyaning birinchi aholisi Maori xalqi ekanligi isbotlangan. Maori xalqi Polineziyadan katta flot bilan Yangi Zelandiyani olib chiqib, u yerda moa nomli yirik qushlarni ovlaydigan agrar jamiyat qurdi. Ammo yangi dalillar Moriori xalqining Yangi Zelandiyadan Chetland orollariga ko'chib o'tgan Maori xalqining bir qismi ekanligini ko'rsatdi. Moriori xalqi o'zlarining o'zgacha, sulhli madaniyatini rivojlantirdi. Chetland orollarida yana bir qism Maori xalqi yashagan. Ularning o'zlarini Moriori deb atagan. Ularning o'rtasida bir necha to'qnaklari bo'lib, oxirida Moriori xalqi yo'q qilindi.
ref: 19 va 20-asrlarda moalar deb ataluvchi ulkan qushlarni ovlovchi Maori xalqi Yangi Zelandiyaning ilk aholisi ekanligiga uzoq vaqt ishonib kelingan. Keyinchalik Maori odamlari Buyuk flotda Polineziyadan ko'chib kelib, Morioridan Yangi Zelandiyani tortib olgani, shu orqali qishloq xo'jaligiga asoslangan jamiyat yaratgani bilan bog'liq g'oyaga asoslangan nazariya paydo bo'ldi. Ammo yangi dalillar Moriorilarning Yangi Zelandiyadan Chatham orollariga ko'chib kelib, o'zlarining boshqalardan farqli, osoyishta madaniyatini yaratgan asosiy maorilar jamosi bo'lganligini ko'rsatadi. Chatem orollarida boshqa bir qabila – Yangi Zelandiyadan ko'chib ketgan Maori qabilasi ham bor edi. Ular o'zlarini Moriorilar deb atagan, bir nechta to'qnashuvlar bo'lgan va oxir-oqibat, Moriorilar yo'q qilingan.

src: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
mt: Toza yer origami - bu faqat bir qatorda qilingan qo'lda ishlatiladigan origami, unda qayta ishlatish qo'llanilmaydi va barcha qo'llanishlar oson joylashgan. U 1970-yillarda John Smith tomonidan ishlab chiqilgan, u o'qituvchilar yoki motor funksiyalari cheklangan odamlarga yordam berish uchun.
ref: Pyurlend origami — bu bir vaqtning o'zida faqat bitta buklama bajarilishi mumkin bo'lgan, teskari buklamalar kabi murakkab buklamalarga yo'l qo'yilmaydigan va barcha buklamalar oddiy o'ringa ega bo'lgan origamidir. U tajribasiz buklovchilarga yoxud harakatlanish ko'nikmalari cheklanganlarga ko'mak berish maqsadida 1970-yillarda Jon Smit tomonidan ishlab chiqilgan.

src: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
mt: Indus daryosi madaniyati - bronza davri madaniyati bo'lib, u modern Pakistan va shimoliy- sharqiy Hindiston va shimoli-sharqiy Afg'onistondagi Indus daryosi havzalarida yashagan. Buning uchun u Indus daryosi nomi bilan ataladi. Biroq, ba'zi olimlar Indus daryosi va hozirgi Sarasvati daryosi bo'lgan daryolar bo'lganligi sababli, u Indus-Sarasvati madaniyatiga nomlanishi kerakligini taxmin qilishadi, ba'zilari uni Harappa nomi bilan atashadi, chunki u 1920-yillarda o'rganilgan birinchi joyi edi.
ref: Hind vodiysi sivilizatsiyasi — hozirgi Pokistonning aksariyat qismi hamda shimoli-sharqiy Afg'oniston va shimoli-g'arbiy Hindistondagi ba'zi viloyatlarni o'z ichiga olgan shimoli-g'arbiy Hindiston subkontinentida joylashgan Bronza davri svilizatsiyasi edi. Bu tamaddun Hind daryosi havzasida gullab-yashnadi, shu sababli uning nomini oldi. Ba'zi olimlar hozirda qurib bitgan Sarasvati daryosi havzalarida ham sivilizatsiya mavjud bo'lganligi sababli, u mos ravishda Hind-Sarasvati sivilizatsiyasi deb nomlanishi kerak, deb ta'kidlasa-da, ayrimlar 1920-yillarda qazilgan joylardan birinchisi — Harappa sharafiga uni Harappa sivilizatsiyasi deb ataydi.

src: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
mt: Qimmat va o'ziga xoslik bizda hozirgacha bo'lgan vaqtga qadar bo'lib qoladi va hamkorlik qilishning tabiiyligi shundan iboratki, aksariyat foydalanishda qimmat va o'ziga xoslik qilishda qisqa muddatda ko'proq foydalanish mumkin bo'lishi mumkin. Umona, ko'pchilik odamlar o'zining eng yaxshi varianti bo'lgan uzun muddatli eng yaxshi variantni ishlab chiqish uchun boshqa odamlar bilan hamkorlik qilishlari mumkin.
ref: Ochko'zlik va xudbinlik doimo biz bilan birga bo'ladi va hamkorlikning tabiati shuki, ko'pchilik foyda ko'radigan holatda xudbinlarcha harakat qilish qisqa muddatli istiqbolda har doim ko'proq foyda keltiradi. Aksariyat kishilar ularning uzoq muddatli eng yaxshi tanlovi – bu boshqalar bilan birgalikda ishlash ekanligini anglab yetadi, deb umid qilamiz.

src: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
mt: Filipinlik xalq o'zlarining puli bilan AQShning Filippinlarni zabt etish uchun harbiy xarajatlari to'lashga majbur bo'ldi. Ular AQSh mustamlakachilik rejimiga pul to'lashlari uchun majburlangan. Ular Filippin xalqining qayg'urishlari uchun Wall Street banklariga qarshi qo'yilgan Filippin hukumatining qarzlarini to'lash uchun pul to'lashlari kerak edi. Shuningdek, AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQShning Filippin xalqini qayg'urishlari uchun o'zining ustun daromadlari AQSh
ref: AQSH imperalizmining Filippinni bosib olishdagi urush harajatlari Filippinliklarning o'zlari tomonidan to'langan. Chiqimlarning asosiy qismini hamda Uoll-strit bank uylari orqali Filippin hukumati nomiga joylashtirilgan obligatsiyalar foizlarini qoplash uchun ular AQSH mustamlakachilik rejimiga soliq to'lovlarini to'lashga majbur qilindi. Shubhasiz, Filippin xalqining davomli ekspluatatsiyasidan olingan ulkan foydalar AQSH imperializmining asosiy daromadlarini tashkil qiladi.

src: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
mt: Templiyorchilarni tushunish uchun ularning yaratilishiga sabab bo'lgan kontekstni tushunish kerak. Bu voqealar sodir bo'lgan davr odatda o'rta asrlar davri sifatida tanilgan, bu esa 11, 12 va 13-asrlarda (AD 1000–1300) yozilgan Yevropa tarixi. O'rta asrlar davri qadimgi o'rta asrlar davri va keyingi o'rta asrlar davri bilan ajralib turadi, bu tushuntirishda 1500 yildan keyin tugaydi.
ref: Tampliyerlarni tushunish uchun ordenni yaratishga turtki bo'lgan muhitni tushunish zarur. Voqealar sodir bo'lgan vaqt umumiy holda Yuqori o'rta asrlar deb ataluvchi Yevropa tarixidagi 11, 12 va 13-asrlardir (m. 1000–1300 yillar). Yuqori o'rta asrlardan keyin Erta o'rta asrlar va undan keyin shartli ravishda 1500-yillar atrofida tugaydigan Kech o'rta asrlar keladi.

src: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
mt: Rim imperiyasi tibbiyot sohasidagi rivojlanishga yordam berdi. Doktorlar Augustus imperatori tomonidan shaxsiy xizmatga chaqirildi va janglarda sodir bo'lgan oqibatlarni bartaraf etish uchun birinchi Rim Tibbiyot Korpusini tashkil etdi. Shifokorlar poppiyadan olingan ekstraktlardan morfin va herbendan olingan skopolamin kabi turli dorilar bilan tanishdilar. Ularning gangrenadan saqlash uchun amputatsiya qilish, qon oqimini to'xtatish uchun tourniquet va arterial klamp kabi qobiliyatlari bor edi. Ko'p asrlar davomida Rim imperiyasi tibbiyot sohasidagi bilimlarni o'z ichiga oladi.
ref: Rim imperiyasining militaristik tabiati tibbiyot yutuqlarining taraqqiyotiga ko'maklashdi. Imperator Avgust shifokorlarni yollay boshladi hamda ular hattoki urushlardan so'ng foydalanish maqsadida birinchi Rim tibbiyot korpusini yaratishdi. Jarrohlar ko'knor urug'i ekstraktlaridan olingan morfin va mingdevona urug'idan olingan skopolaminni o'z ichiga olgan turli tinchlantiruvchi vositalar to'g'risida ma'lumotga ega edilar. Ular kasallarni gangrenadan saqlash uchun amputatsiya qilish, shuningdek, qon oqishini to'xtatish uchun turniket va arterial qisqichlardan foydalanishda mohir bo'lib olishdi. Bir necha asrlar davomida Rim imperiyasi tibbiyot sohasida ulkan g'alabalarga erishgan va hozirgi vaqtda bizga ma'lum bilimlarning katta qismini shakllantirdi.

src: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."
mt: "Sikxizm — bu Hindiston yarim orolida dini. Uning asoschisi 15-asrda Panjobda bo'lgan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'analaridan ajralib chiqqan bo'lib, u hindu an'an
ref: "Sikxizm Hind submaterigidagi dindir. U Panjob mintaqasida 15-asrda Hinduizm an'analari doirasidagi sektalarga bo'linish natijasida kelib chiqqan. Sikxlar garchi o'z e'tiqodlarining Hinduizm asosidagi ildizlar va an'analarga egaligini tan olsalar ham, uni hinduizmdan alohida din deb hisoblaydilar. Sikxlar o'z dinini ""Gurmat"" deb ataydi, bu panjob tilida ""guru yo'li"" degani. Guru barcha hind dinlarining asosiy xususiyatidir, biroq sikxizmda sikx e'tiqodi asosini tashkil etuvchi ahamiyatga ega. Mazkur dinga Guru Nanak (1469–1539) tomonidan 15-asrda asos solingan. So'ngra to'qqiz nafar guru ketma-ket ergashdi."

src: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."
mt: "E'tibor buzish sindromi "nevrologik sindrom bo'lib, uning klassik belgilangan triadasi, jumladan, impulsivlik, qo'rqoqsizlik va faollashish yoki o'z-o'zidan energiya"ni o'z ichiga oladi. U o'qish muammolari emas, u o'qish muammosi; u "barcha bolalar orasida 3 dan 5 gacha foizni tashkil etadi, shuningdek, 2 million amerikalik bolalarni tashkil etishi mumkin". ADDga egalar o'qishga qiziqishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi, ammo ular o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'liq muammolarga duch kelishadi. Boshqa bolalar o'qishlari bilan bog'liq narsalarga e'tibor bermasliklari bilan bog'li
ref: "Diqqatni jamlay olmaslik buzilishi ""bu nevrologik sindrom bo'lib, uning klassik aniqlovchi alomatlari impulsivlik, chalg'ituvchanlik va giperfaollik yoki ortiqcha energiyani o'z ichiga oladi"". Bu o'rganishga layoqatsizlik emas, bu o'rganish faoliyatidagi buzilish; bu ""barcha bolalarning 3–5 foizi, ehtimol, qariyb 2 million amerikalik bolalarga ta'sir o'tkazadi"". ADDga yo'liqqan bolalar o'qish mashg'ulotlari kabi narsalarga diqqat jamlashga qiynaladi, lekin ular o'yinlar o'ynash yoki sevimli multfilmlarini tomosha qilish yoxud gaplarni tinish belgilarisiz yozish kabi narsalarga diqqatini jamlay oladi. Ushbu bolalar odatda ko'p muammolarga duch keladi, chunki ular o'zlarining ongini odatiy usullar bilan rag'batlantira olmaganliklari uchun rag'batlantirish maqsadida ""qaltis xatti-harakatlarda ishtirok etishadi, janjallarga kirishishadi va hokimiyatga qarshi chiqishadi"". ADD boshqa tengdoshlar bilan munosabatlarga ta'sir qiladi, chunki boshqa bolalar ularning o'zlarini nega bunday tutishini yoki nega bunday talaffuz qilishini yoxud ularning yetuklik darajasi boshqacha ekanini tushuna olmaydilar."

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
mt: Proyekt asosidagi o'qish orqali o'qishni osonroq va qiziqarliroq qilishni ta'minlashi kerak, lekin qurilishdan o'tishga bir qadam o'tadi. Qurilish uslubini o'qish emas, balki o'qish jarayonida yangi tajriba o'tkazayotgan shaxslarga yordam berish uchun mo'ljallangan vosita. Qurilishlar virtual va real bo'lishi mumkin, degan ma'noni anglatadi, ya'ni o'qituvchi qurilish shaklida bo'lishi mumkin, lekin shuningdek, Microsoft Office dasturida mavjud bo'lgan kichik papirklar shaklidagi qurilish ham bo'lishi mumkin.
ref: Loyihaga asoslangan ta'lim o'rganishni osonroq va qiziqarli qilsa, ko'mak chegaralardan ham oshadi. Havoza ta'lim berish usuli emas, balki yangi kompyuter dasturidan foydalanish yoki yangi loyihani boshlash singari yangi tajribani boshidan o'tkazayotgan kishilarga ko'rsatiladigan yordamdir. Havozalar ham virtual, ham haqiqiy bo'lishi mumkin, boshqacha qilib aytadigan bo'lsak, o'qituvchi havoza shaklidir, biroq Microsoft Office'dagi kichkina odamsifat qog'oz qisqich ham shunday. Virtual ko'mak dasturiy ta'minot ichiga o'rnatilgan va ular talaba o'zi hal qilishi qiyin bo'lgan jarayonlar haqida savol berish, yordam berish, tushuntirish uchun mo'ljallangan.

src: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
mt: MySpace AQSHda uchinchi eng mashhur veb-sayt bo'lib, hozir 54 million profilga ega. Bu veb-saytlar o'qituvchilar tomonidan katta e'tiborga ega, xususan, o'qituvchilar tomonidan. Ushbu veb-saytlarda yozuvlar, video, fotosuratlar va boshqa xususiyatlarni o'z ichiga olgan sinf sahifalari o'rnatish juda oson. Buning uchun faqat bir veb-sayt manzilini berish kerak, bu juda oson eslab qolish va o'qituvchilar tomonidan o'qishda qiyinchiliklar yuz berishi mumkin bo'lgan talabalar uchun juda oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'qishni oson yozishni o'q
ref: MySpace Qo'shma Shtatlarda foydalaniladigan uchinchi eng mashhur sayt hisoblanadi va ayni vaqtda 54 millionta profilga ega. Bu veb-saytlar, xususan, ta'lim muassasalarida yuqori e'tibor qozondi. Mazkur veb-saytlar ijobiy jihatlarga ega, jumladan, bloglar, videolar, rasmlar va boshqa xususiyatlarni o'z ichiga olgan sinf sahifasini osongina o'rnata oladi. Mazkur sahifaga birgina veb-manzilni ko'rsatish orqali osongina kirish mumkin, bu klaviaturadan foydalanish yoki imloda muammolari bor talabalar uchun yozish va eslab qolishni osonlashtiradi. Uni o'qishni osonlashtirish, shuningdek kerakli darajada ko'proq yoki kamroq rangli qilib sozlash mumkin.

src: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
mt: Shuningdek, 1956-yil iyun oyida Polshada ishchilar oziq-ovqat yetishmovchiligi va maoshlardagi qisqartirishlarga qarshi norozilik namoyishlari umumiy norozilikka aylanganida, Krushchevning ta'jilatlarini sinab ko'rdi. Buning natijasida, u nihoyatda tartibga solish uchun tanklarni yubordi, lekin ba'zi iqtisodiy talablarga yo'l qo'ydi va mashhur Wladyslaw Gomulka yangi bosh vazir etib saylandi.
ref: Biroq 1956-yilning iyunida xodimlar oziq-ovqat tanqisligi hamda ish haqi kamaytirilishiga qarshi namoyishlar o'tkazayotgan joyda, kommunizmga qarshi umumiy norozilikka aylanib ketganda, Polshadagi tartibsizliklar vaqtida Xrushchevning va'dalari sinovdan o'tkazildi. Oxir-oqibat, Xrushchyov tartibni qayta tiklash maqsadida tanklarni yuborganligiga qaramay, u ayrim iqtisodiy talablarga yon berdi hamda mashhur Vladislav Gomulkani yangi bosh vazir etib tayinlashga rozilik berdi.

src: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
mt: Ikkinchi jahon urushi davrida Germaniya Sovet Ittifoqi va AQSH uchun umumiy dushman bo'lganligi sababli, ular o'rtasida hamkorlik mavjud bo'lgan. Urush tugaganidan ikki yildan so'ng, sobiq ittifoqchilar o'rtasida tizim, jarayon va madaniyatga ko'ra kelib chiqqan to'qnashuvlar natijasida urush boshlandi. Urush 40 yil davom etdi va u yerda Afrika, Osiyo, Afg'oniston, Kubada va boshqa joylarda real jihatdan, shuningdek, proxy armiyalar tomonidan kurashilgan.
ref: Germaniya Ikkinchi jahon urushida SSSR bilan AQSH o'rtasidagi hamkorlikka sababchi bo'lgan umumiy dushman edi. Urush tugashi bilan tizim, taraqqiyot jarayoni hamda madaniyat to'qnashuvlari davlatlarni o'zaro nizoga boshladi. Urush tugaganidan ikki yil o'tgach, sobiq ittifoqdoshlar endilikda dushmanga aylangandi hamda Sovuq urush boshlandi. U keyingi 40 yil davom etishi va Afrikadan tortib Osiyogacha, Afg'oniston, Kuba va boshqa ko'pgina jang maydonlarida proxi armiyalar tomonidan haqiqiy jang olib borilishi kerak edi.

src: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
mt: Nervous System tana ichida qon oqimini saqlab qolish uchun tashqi tahdidlardan himoya qilish uchun tana bo'ylab yorug'lik impulsini tezda yuboradi.
ref: Asab tizimi uzluksiz qon oqimini ta'minlash uchun tana bo'ylab asab impulslarini yuborish orqali gomeostazni ta'minlaydi. Mazkur asab impulslari tana bo'ylab nihoyatda tez yuboriladi, bu esa vujudni har qanday ehtimoliy xvafdan saqlashga yordam beradi.

src: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
mt: Giza shahridagi Buyuk piramida Giza shahrida yashagan yagona yodgorlik bo'lib, u miloddan avvalgi 3-asrda Misrliklar tomonidan qurilgan. Buyuk piramida Pharaoh sharafiga qurilgan bir qancha katta piramida tuzilmalari orasida eng katta bo'lib, u Pharaoh Khufu sharafiga qurilgan. Buyuk piramida tashqarisida bir qancha kichik qabrlar, bir qancha ibodatxonalar va Giza shahrida yashagan yodgorlik bo'lib, u miloddan avvalgi 3-asrda Misrliklar tomonidan qurilgan. Buyuk piramida Pharaoh sharafiga qurilgan bir qancha katta piramida tuzilmalari orasida eng katta bo'lib, u Pharaoh Khufu sharafiga qurilgan. Buyuk piramida tashqarisida bir qancha kichik qabrlar, bir qancha ibodatxonalar va Giza shahrida yashagan yodgorlik bo'lib, u miloddan avvalgi 3-asrda Misrliklar tomonidan qurilgan. Buyuk piramida Pharaoh sharafiga qurilgan bir qancha katta piramida tuzilmalari orasida eng katta bo'lib, u Pharaoh Khufu sharafiga qurilgan. Buyuk piramida tashqarisida bir qancha kichik qabrlar, bir qancha ibodatxonalar va Giza shahrida yashagan yodgorlik bo'lib, u miloddan avvalgi 3-asrda Misrliklar tomonidan qurilgan. Buyuk piramida Pharaoh sharafiga qurilgan bir qancha katta piramida tuzilmalari orasida eng katta bo'lib, u Pharaoh Khufu sharafiga qurilgan. Buyuk piramida tashqarisida bir qancha kichik qabrlar, bir qancha
ref: "Giza shahridagi Buyuk piramida bugun ham mavjud bo'lgan yetti mo'jizaning biridir. Eramizdan avvalgi uchinchi asrda misrliklar tomonidan bunyod etilgan Buyuk Piramida vafot etgan Fir'avn sharafiga barpo qilingan ko'plab yirik piramida inshootlaridan biri hisoblanadi. Misr o'liklar vodiysidagi Giza platosi yoki ""Giza qabristoni"" bir qancha piramidalar (ularning eng yirigi — buyuk piramida), bir nechta kichik qabrlar, bir qancha ibodatxonalar va buyuk Sfinksni o'z ichiga oladi. Buyuk piramida fir'avn Xufu sharafiga bunyod etilgan hamda ko'plab kichik piramidalar, maqbaralar va ma'badlar Xufuning xotinlari hamda oila a'zolarining sharafiga bunyod etilgan."
